questions.text: Enzyme present in both glycolysis and gluconeogenesis?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Phosphoglycerate kinase The common enzyme of glycolysis and gluconeogenesis is phosphoglycerate kinase which interconverts 1,3- bis-phospho glycerate and 3-phosphoglycerate. It’s an example of Substrate Level Phosphorylation. Enzyme PFK and pyruvate kinase are specific to glycolysis while PEP-CK is used in gluconeogenesis to form PEP by decarboxylation of Oxaloacetate. Pyruvate kinase, glucokinase & PFK (phosphofructokinase) are the irreversible steps of glycolysis, so these cannot be used in gluconeogenesis.

Solution:

Pyridoxine Pyridoxine dependent Seizures in neonates is a rare autosomal recessive disorder. It is an inborn abnormality of the enzyme glutamic acid decarboxylase. There is reduced pyridoxine-dependent synthesis of the inhibitory neurotransmitter gamma amino butyric acid (GABA) for which pyridoxal phosphate is the coenzyme as shown below: Reported symptoms include: autism, breath holding and severe mental retardation hepatomegaly bilious vomiting transient visual agnosia squint severe articulatory apraxia motor dyspraxia microcephaly Intrauterine seizures However, full range of symptomatology is unknown.

questions.text: Calories from TPN: 100 mg dextrose, 30 mg Amino acids & 40 mg Lipids
questions.explanation:
Solution:

880 Macronutrient Calorific value (kcal/g) in body Carbohydrates 4 Fats 9 Proteins 4 From table: Calories from 100mg dextrose: 4000 x 0.1g = 400 cal Calories from 30mg amino acids: 4000 x 0.03g = 120 cal Calories from 40mg amino acids: 9000 x 0.04g = 360 cal Total – 400 +120 + 360 = 880 calories

questions.text: Which of the following is not an enzyme in cholesterol biosynthesis?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

HMG CoA lyase HMG CoA synthase and Thiolase are common enzymes in cholesterol and ketone body synthesis pathway. HMG-CoA lyase is exclusively involved in KB synthesis pathway. It breaks HMG CoA into acetyl-CoA and acetoacetate (first Ketone body) whereas HMG CoA reductase is exclusively involved in cholesterol biosynthesis is the RLE of this pathway. (Refer to fig below)

questions.text: DNA Methylation is not related with?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Capping In the mammalian genome, DNA methylation is an epigenetic mechanism involving the transfer of a methyl group onto the C5 position of the cytosine to form 5-methylcytosine. Mismatch Repair: In mismatch repair errors in only the newly synthesized strand are repaired. The repair machinery identify this strand by being not methylated. This mechanism makes sure that the repair machinery doesn’t affect the correct parent strand which is methylated. DNA Replication: Dnmt (DNA Methyl Transferases) functions during DNA replication to copy the DNA methylation pattern from the parental DNA strand onto the newly synthesized daughter strand. This maintenance methylation activity is necessary to preserve DNA methylation after every cellular DNA replication cycle. Epigenetics: Extensive methylation of cytosine of the DNA at CG sites by DNA Methyl Transferases (DNMTs) is an epigenetics phenomenon which can either result in Gene silencing or Gene activation. Capping of mRNA in eukaryotes: 7-Methyl Guanosine cap is added at the 5’ end of mRNA by enzyme Guanylyl Transferase. So, this is RNA methylation, not DNA. Methyl group is donated by SAM (S-Adenosyl Methionine). This cap facilitate initiation of translation and stabilize mRNA by preventing it from attack by 5’ exonucleases.

questions.text: Which value is not required to measure Creatinine Clearance?

options.label: C
options.text: Volume of Serum passing through kidney in 24 hour

questions.correct_answer: C. Volume of Serum passing through kidney in 24 hour
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Volume of Serum passing through kidney in 24 hour For Creatinine clearance, sample components required are: 24-hour urine specimen A serum sample (preferably taken at the midpoint of the 24-hour urine collection.) Total Volume of urine in 24 hours Then creatinine in both serum and urine is measured spectrophotometrically. Creatinine clearance is calculated using the general clearance formula UV/P , where, U - Urine creatinine concentration, V - Urine volume excreted in 24 hours, P - Serum creatinine concentration

Solution:

Competitive Inhibition Dicumarol is a competitive inhibitor of vitamin K epoxide reductase, an enzyme that recycles vitamin K, thus causing depletion of active vitamin K in blood.

questions.text: Ammonia is detoxified in brain, by leading to formation of?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Glutamine The transport form of Ammonia in blood from Brain and from most tissues is Glutamine . From muscles, it is Alanine.

questions.text: Glucose is stored in Glycogen form, why?

options.label: B
options.text: Can be reduced from multiple branches/ends

options.label: C
options.text: Can be stored at multiple sites

options.label: D
options.text: Can provide glucose as much as needed and when needed for 1 week

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Compact Benefits of storing of glucose as glycogen : In liver cells glucose is stored in a compact form as glycogen granules in the Compactness of glycogen allow storage in smaller space as compared to equivalent glucose. If all the glucose present in glycogen is stored as free glucose, the concentration of glucose in cell will be very high that will cause the cell to take up water by osmosis and lysis will occur. There is only 1 reducing end in the molecule of glycogen (see fig 3.39) (Option 2 is false). It is mainly stored at two sites liver and muscles (Option 3 is false). Liver glycogen provides glucose to blood for 12 – 18 hours only (Option 3 is false)
